intro: Periptera punicea, commonly known as the firecracker plant, is a flowering species native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that resemble tiny fireworks. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Periptera punicea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
